thread.title: Texas Twitter war: Longhorn players fight on social media
thread.title_full: Texas Twitter war: Longhorn players fight on social media | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: Texas Twitter war: Longhorn players fight on social media
text:
The Longhorns held a team meeting after their 50-7 loss to TCU.
Head coach Charlie Strong said the coaches and the players were back on the same page after the meeting. At Monday's weekly press conference, junior safety Dylan Haines, however, said the younger players weren't putting in enough work.
"(The freshman) just want to go and play, I think that's with any freshman" Haines said. "A lot of [the freshman didn't] have to watch film in high school if you're recruited at that level. You don't have to go out there and put in extra work ... They just want to go out and play on Saturday. They don't want to put in the work on Sunday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. We go out there and practice but you can just go through the motions in practice or you can practice."
After Haines questioned the work habits of Texas' freshman, those players responded on Twitter.
Freshman defensive end Charles Omenihu questioned Haines' logic.
Texas' 2015 team, y'all. This is freshman DE Charles Omenihu referring to Dylan Haines' comments. pic.twitter.com/f7twBECDfJ
— Chris Hummer (@chris_hummer) October 5, 2015
#Texas S Dylan Haines calls out young players, frosh responds. Things are getting uglier. http://t.co/9qTTNhmnGK pic.twitter.com/QtXWlSCZto
— Burnt Orange Nation (@BON_SBNation) October 5, 2015 Freshman wide receiver DeAndre McNeal tweeted that Texas' freshman "are go getters and we don't accept mediocre anything. We are here to pull Texas out of the drought so you can either get with it or get lost."
#LetsRide #HookEm pic.twitter.com/s67osCbjJb
— The DeAndre McNeal6â£ (@tbhmcNEal) October 5, 2015 This is the second time the Longhorns have had issues on Twitter in the last three days. During halftime in Texas' game against TCU, freshman cornerback Kris Boyd retweeted a tweet which mentioned him transferring to Texas A&M.
